snippet: Big banks are trying to sell higher-margin products like mutual funds, stocks and retirement advice to customers who have assets in the hundreds of thousands as a way to raise their revenue.
abstract: Banks are offering a wide range of new perks to customers with assets in the hundreds of thousands of dollars, who are more likely to buy higher-margin products like mutual funds, stocks and retirement advice; amenities include separate lounges, and after-hours banking; analysts say new approach is a response to regulations that have cut the profitability of fees, causing banks to seek a wider share of the large number of Americans with moderate wealth.
lead_paragraph: Big banks are trying to sell higher-margin products like mutual funds, stocks and retirement advice to customers who have assets in the hundreds of thousands as a way to raise their revenue.

headline.seo: To Increase Revenue, Banks Go After Affluent
headline.main: Got $100,000? Have a Cookie: Banks Try Luring the Top 10%
headline.print_headline: Got $100,000? Have a Cookie: Banks Try Luring the Top 10%
